Header.Name: toolServiceInfo
Header.Description: Groups together elements required for the description of tools and services

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Specifies the type of the resource being described or the type of the resource that a tool or service takes as input or produces as output

item.@AppInfo: used for tools, systems, system components etc.

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Specifies the type of the tool or service

item.@AppInfo: A form in which NLP taks are realized and delivered to a user, without the need of acquiring and installing the corresponding tools
A technology that eases the development of new tools and services in the NLP field
A device that performs one or more of the tasks listed in the ForeseenUseInfo component
A more of less fixed integrated organisation of tools applied for solving a combinaton of tasks
A technology that supports the flexible development of NLP applications, together with all the requested resources
A technology that supports the development of data resources, like lexicons, grammars, corpora, etc. Can be included in an Architecture or in a Platform

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Specifies the subtype of tool or service
Indicates whether the operation of the tool or service is language dependent or not

Specifies the media type of the resource and basically corresponds to the physical medium of the content representation. Each media type is described through a distinctive set of features. A resource may consist of parts attributed to different types of media. A tool/service may take as input/output more than one different media types.

item.@AppInfo: only written medium
for a whole resource or part of a resource that is recorded as an audio file
for moving image; used for multi-media corpora, with video for the moving image part
for stillimage like photographs, drawings etc.
for the description of sensorimotor data (e.g. biological measurements, geospatial data etc.)

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Specifies the type of the resource being described or the type of the resource that a tool or service takes as input or produces as output

item.@AppInfo: for text, speech, video, multimodal/multimedia corpora, corpora with sensorimotor information, n-gram resources
includes lexica, ontologies, dictionaries, word lists etc.
covers grammars etc.

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Specifies the type of the modality represented in the resource or processed by a tool/service

A human understandable name of the language that is used in the resource or supported by the tool/service; an autocompletion mechanism with values from the ISO 639 is provided in the editor, but the values can be subsequently edited for further specification (according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines)

The identifier of the language that is included in the resource or supported by the tool/service; an autocompletion mechanism with values from the ISO 639 is provided in the editor, but the values can be subsequently edited for further specification (according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines)
The name of the language variety that occurs in the resource or is supported by a tool/service

The mime-type of the resource which is a formalized specifier for the format included or a mime-type that the tool/service accepts; value to be taken from a subset of the official mime types of the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority
The name of the character encoding used in the resource or accepted by the tool/service
Specifies the annotation level of the resource or the annotation type a tool/ service requires or produces as an output
Specifies the format that is used in the annotation process since often the mime type will not be sufficient for machine processing
A name or a URL intended as reference for the tagset used in the annotation of the resource or by the tool/service
Specifies the segmentation unit in terms of which the resource has been segmented or the level of segmentation a tool/service requires/outputs
Specifies the standards or the best practices to which the tagset used for the annotation conforms

Specifies the media type of the resource and basically corresponds to the physical medium of the content representation. Each media type is described through a distinctive set of features. A resource may consist of parts attributed to different types of media. A tool/service may take as input/output more than one different media types.

item.@AppInfo: only written medium
for a whole resource or part of a resource that is recorded as an audio file
for moving image; used for multi-media corpora, with video for the moving image part
for stillimage like photographs, drawings etc.
for the description of sensorimotor data (e.g. biological measurements, geospatial data etc.)

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Specifies the type of the resource being described or the type of the resource that a tool or service takes as input or produces as output

item.@AppInfo: for text, speech, video, multimodal/multimedia corpora, corpora with sensorimotor information, n-gram resources
includes lexica, ontologies, dictionaries, word lists etc.
covers grammars etc.

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Specifies the type of the modality represented in the resource or processed by a tool/service

A human understandable name of the language that is used in the resource or supported by the tool/service; an autocompletion mechanism with values from the ISO 639 is provided in the editor, but the values can be subsequently edited for further specification (according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines)

The identifier of the language that is included in the resource or supported by the tool/service; an autocompletion mechanism with values from the ISO 639 is provided in the editor, but the values can be subsequently edited for further specification (according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines)
The name of the language variety that occurs in the resource or is supported by a tool/service

The mime-type of the resource which is a formalized specifier for the format included or a mime-type that the tool/service accepts; value to be taken from a subset of the official mime types of the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority
The name of the character encoding used in the resource or accepted by the tool/service
Specifies the annotation level of the resource or the annotation type a tool/ service requires or produces as an output
Specifies the format that is used in the annotation process since often the mime type will not be sufficient for machine processing
A name or a URL intended as reference for the tagset used in the annotation of the resource or by the tool/service
Specifies the segmentation unit in terms of which the resource has been segmented or the level of segmentation a tool/service requires/outputs
Specifies the standards or the best practices to which the tagset used for the annotation conforms
The operating system on which the tool will be running
Gives information on the running time of a tool or service
Hardware required for running a tool and/or computational grammar
Provides further information on the running environment in free text mode
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
Indicates whether the tool or service has been evaluated
Indicates the evaluation level
Indicates the evaluation type
Defines the criteria of the evaluation of a tool
Defines whether the evaluation measure is human or automatic
Provides further information on the evaluation process of a tool or service
role of documents
Specifies the type of the document provided with or related to the resource

item.@AppInfo: An article from a journal or magazine
A book with an explicit publisher
A work that is printed and bound, but without a named publisher or sponsoring institution
Technical documentation
A report published by a school or other institution
A Master's thesis
A PhD thesis
A part of a book, which may be a chapter (or section) and/or a range of pages
A part of a book having its own title
The proceedings of a conference
An article in a conference proceedings
A document having an author and title, but not formally published
Use this type when nothing else fits

CMD_Element.@Documentation: The title of the document; the element can be repeated for the different language versions using the "lang" attribute to specify the language.
The name(s) of the author(s); for multiple authors, please use "and" in between.
The name(s) of the editor(s); in case of multiple editors, please use "and" in between
The year of publication or, for an unpublished work, the year it was written
The name of the publisher/publishing house
The title of a book, part of which is being cited
A journal name; abbreviations could also be provided
Specifies the volume of a journal or multivolume book

The name of a series or set of books; when citing an entire book, the title field gives its title and an optional series field gives the name of a series or multi-volume set in which the book is published
One or more page numbers or range of page numbers
The edition of a book
The name of the conference in which the document has been presented
A digital object identifier assigned to the document
A URL used as homepage of an entity (e.g. of a person, organization, resource etc.) and/or where an entity (e.g. LR, document etc.) is located
The International Standard Serial Number used to identify a journal
The International Standard Book Number
The keyword(s) for indexing and classification of the document

The name of the language the document is written in, as mentioned in IETF BCP47; an autocompletion mechanism with values from the ISO 639 is provided in the editor, but the values can be subsequently edited for further specification (according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines)

The id of the language the document is written in; an autocompletion mechanism with values from the ISO 639 is provided in the editor, but the values can be subsequently edited for further specification (according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines)
role of documents
Used either as a free text description or as an unstructured (free form) presentation of a bibliographic record; alternative to the structured presentation of a document (cf. documentInfo)
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
role of a person or organization; used for the conversion to META-SHARE
The surname (family name) of a person related to the resource
The given name (first name) of a person related to the resource; initials can also be used
The sex of a person related to or participating in the resource
The position or the title of a person if affiliated to an organization
The email address of a person or an organization
A URL used as homepage of an entity (e.g. of a person, organization, resource etc.) and/or where an entity (e.g. LR, document etc.) is located
The street and the number of the postal address of a person or organization
The zip code of the postal address of a person or organization
The name of the city, town or village as mentioned in the postal address of a person or organization
The name of the region, county or department as mentioned in the postal address of a person or organization
The name of the country mentioned in the postal address of a person or organization as defined in the list of values of ISO 3166
The telephone number of a person or an organization; recommended format: +_international code_city code_number
The fax number of a person or an organization; recommended format: +_international code_city code_number
role of person or organization; to be used for the conversion to MetaShare
The full name of an organization
The short name (abbreviation, acronym etc.) used for an organization
The name of the department or unit (e.g. specific university faculty or department, department or unit of a research organization or private company etc.)
The email address of a person or an organization
A URL used as homepage of an entity (e.g. of a person, organization, resource etc.) and/or where an entity (e.g. LR, document etc.) is located

The fax number of a person or an organization; recommended format: +_international code_city code_number

The name of the country mentioned in the postal address of a person or organization as defined in the list of values of ISO 3166
The telephone number of a person or an organization; recommended format: +_international code_city code_number
The fax number of a person or an organization; recommended format: +_international code_city code_number
The programming languages needed for allowing user contributions, or for running the tools, in case no executables are available
Reference (name, bibliographic reference or link to url) for the formalism used for the creation/enrichment of the resource (grammar or tool/service)
Provides additional information on the creation of a tool or service
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
